core_exploration.central_question: How can I establish my professional identity as a solo practitioner?
core_exploration.key_tension: Between individual practice and collaborative facilitation methodology
core_exploration.breakthrough_moment: Recognition of the need to articulate professional identity clearly
core_exploration.edge_of_understanding: How to fully develop and communicate their unique approach to Simon facilitation

conceptual_dna: Professional identity emerges through clear articulation of specialized practice
Solo practice can embody collaborative methodologies

bridge_potential.novel_synthesis: Individual practitioner applying group facilitation methodology
bridge_potential.cross_domain_pattern: Specialized expertise can be delivered through various practice models

raw_essence: S.A. Hall identifies as a solo Simon facilitator, representing a focused professional practice in specialized facilitation methodology. This suggests an individual approach to delivering what may traditionally be group-oriented services.
embedding_text: solo practitioner, Simon facilitation, professional identity, specialized methodology, individual practice, facilitation services
